tasks.title: Design index strategy for inventory tables
tasks.description: Catalog the actual read/write patterns hitting InventoryTransactions, Products, and AuditLogs; profile high cost queries; propose composite indexes with selectivity rationale and measurement plan.

subtasks.title: Catalog read/write patterns
subtasks.description: Analyze and document the actual read and write patterns for InventoryTransactions, Products, and AuditLogs.
subtasks.details:
Focus on identifying the frequency and types of queries being executed against the inventory tables.
<info added on 2025-09-26T15:30:16.069Z>
Cataloged read/write patterns across controllers/services and drafted index strategy. Key filters include: InventoryTransactions by ProductId, WarehouseId, Type, Date; Products by CategoryId, ManufacturerId, IsActive + LIKE on Name/SKU; AuditLogs by UserId, EntityName+EntityId, Timestamp. Next: profile high-cost queries (1.2). See docs/index-strategy.md for details and rationale.
</info added on 2025-09-26T15:30:16.069Z>

subtasks.title: Profile high cost queries
subtasks.description: Identify and profile the high cost queries affecting performance in the inventory tables.
subtasks.details:
Use query execution plans and performance metrics to determine which queries are consuming the most resources.
<info added on 2025-09-26T15:33:07.761Z>
Prepared baseline profiling scripts for PostgreSQL. See scripts/sql/measure-before.sql and docs/index-strategy.md (How to run profiling). Next: execute against staging DB, attach EXPLAIN ANALYZE outputs, and summarize hotspots to guide index DDL for task #2.
</info added on 2025-09-26T15:33:07.761Z>
<info added on 2025-09-26T15:35:20.866Z>
Ran baseline profiling inside Docker container 'inventory-postgres-staging'. Saved EXPLAIN outputs to .ai-temp/measure-before.out. Hotspot: AuditLogs query by (EntityName='Product', EntityId='42') performs Seq Scan (rows removed ~6750) — requires composite index (EntityName, EntityId). Other patterns look acceptable with existing single-column indexes but benefit from composites (e.g., (ProductId, Date)).
</info added on 2025-09-26T15:35:20.866Z>

subtasks.title: Propose composite indexes
subtasks.description: Develop a proposal for composite indexes based on the cataloged patterns and profiled queries.
subtasks.details: Include rationale for each proposed index focusing on selectivity and performance improvement.

subtasks.title: Document selectivity rationale
subtasks.description: Create documentation explaining the rationale behind the selectivity of the proposed composite indexes.
subtasks.details: Provide examples and metrics to support the proposed index strategy.

subtasks.title: Create measurement plan
subtasks.description: Develop a plan to measure the performance impact of the proposed indexes once implemented.
subtasks.details: Outline key performance indicators and benchmarks to assess the effectiveness of the new indexes.

tasks.title: Add EF migration for critical indexes
tasks.description: Create an EF Core migration applying the approved indexes, adjust DbContext configurations if needed, and capture before/after performance metrics for key queries. Performance indexes have been applied in Docker Postgres via scripts/sql/apply-indexes.sql, and significant speedups have been verified with scripts/sql/measure-after.sql. Key improvements include InventoryTransactions queries using new composite indexes with Index Scan/Index Only Scan, and AuditLogs (EntityName, EntityId) now utilizing an index instead of Seq Scan.
tasks.details: See .ai-temp/measure-before.out and .ai-temp/measure-after.out for detailed performance metrics.
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure that the migration is applied correctly and that performance improvements are validated against the captured metrics.

subtasks.details: Use the EF Core tools to scaffold a new migration that includes the necessary index changes.

subtasks.details: Review the DbContext class and ensure that it reflects the changes made in the migration.

subtasks.details: Identify key queries, run them to gather baseline metrics, and prepare for post-migration comparison.

subtasks.title: Test the Migration
subtasks.description: Run tests to ensure the migration is applied correctly and performance metrics are as expected.
subtasks.details: Perform unit tests and integration tests to validate the migration and its impact on performance.

subtasks.title: Verify Performance Improvements
subtasks.description: Review the performance metrics captured in .ai-temp/measure-before.out and .ai-temp/measure-after.out to confirm the effectiveness of the applied indexes.
subtasks.details: Ensure that the observed speedups align with the expected improvements from the new indexes.

Added SQL reconciliation report: scripts/sql/reconcile-quantities.sql. Compares Products.Quantity with vw_product_on_hand computed values and outputs delta for top mismatches. Next: run inside Docker and attach report; propose remediation steps (adjustment transactions vs manual fix).
</info added on 2025-09-26T15:42:03.406Z>
